documents.title: Articles of Association - Extract: Shareholder Rights
documents.content:
ARTICLES OF ASSOCIATION

Tech Innovations Limited
Company Registration No.: 2345678

Adopted: March 15, 2020

[EXTRACT - RELEVANT PROVISIONS]

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════
PART 5: SHARES AND SHAREHOLDERS
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Article 15: Classes of Shares

15.1 The Company may issue ordinary shares and preference shares with such rights, privileges, restrictions and conditions as the Board may determine from time to time, subject to the Companies Ordinance.

15.2 Ordinary shares shall confer on the holders:
   (a) The right to receive notice of and attend general meetings
   (b) The right to vote on resolutions (one vote per share)
   (c) The right to receive dividends when declared
   (d) The right to participate in distribution of surplus assets on winding up

Article 16: Voting Rights

16.1 Subject to any rights or restrictions attached to any shares:
   (a) On a show of hands, every shareholder present in person shall have one vote
   (b) On a poll, every shareholder shall have one vote for each share held

16.2 A shareholder may vote in person or by proxy.

16.3 A proxy need not be a shareholder.

16.4 An instrument appointing a proxy must be in writing and delivered to the Company at least 48 hours before the meeting.

16.5 A corporate shareholder may appoint a representative to attend and vote on its behalf.

Article 17: Restrictions on Voting

17.1 No shareholder shall vote at any general meeting if any call or other sum presently payable by such shareholder to the Company remains unpaid.

17.2 No objection to the qualification of any voter shall be raised except at the meeting at which the vote objected to is tendered.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════
PART 6: GENERAL MEETINGS
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Article 20: Annual General Meeting

20.1 The Company shall hold an Annual General Meeting (AGM) in each year within 6 months after the end of its financial year.

20.2 Not more than 15 months shall elapse between one AGM and the next.

Article 21: Extraordinary General Meetings

21.1 The Board may convene an Extraordinary General Meeting (EGM) whenever it thinks fit.

21.2 Shareholders holding not less than 5% of the paid-up capital may requisition an EGM by depositing a written requisition at the registered office.

21.3 The Board must convene a requisitioned EGM within 21 days of receiving a valid requisition, and the meeting must be held within 28 days of the notice convening the meeting.

Article 22: Notice of General Meetings

22.1 Notice of every general meeting must be given to:
   (a) All shareholders
   (b) All directors
   (c) The auditor

22.2 The notice period shall be:
   (a) For an AGM: Not less than 21 clear days
   (b) For an EGM: Not less than 14 clear days
   (c) For an EGM to pass a special resolution: Not less than 21 clear days

22.3 A general meeting may be called on shorter notice if agreed by:
   (a) For an AGM: All shareholders entitled to attend and vote
   (b) For an EGM: Shareholders holding at least 95% of voting rights

22.4 The notice must specify:
   - Date, time and place of meeting
   - General nature of business
   - Text of special resolutions
   - Shareholder's right to appoint proxy

Article 23: Quorum

23.1 No business shall be transacted at any general meeting unless a quorum is present.

23.2 The quorum for a general meeting shall be:
   - Two (2) shareholders present in person or by proxy, representing at least 25% of the issued share capital

23.3 If within 30 minutes from the time appointed for the meeting a quorum is not present:
   (a) If requisitioned by shareholders: the meeting is dissolved
   (b) In any other case: the meeting stands adjourned to the same day in the next week at the same time and place

23.4 At an adjourned meeting, one shareholder present in person or by proxy shall constitute a quorum.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════
PART 7: DIVIDENDS AND RESERVES
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Article 30: Declaration of Dividends

30.1 The Company in general meeting may declare dividends by ordinary resolution, but no dividend shall exceed the amount recommended by the Board.

30.2 The Board may pay interim dividends if justified by the Company's financial position.

30.3 All dividends shall be paid in proportion to the amounts paid up on the shares.

30.4 No dividend shall bear interest against the Company.

Article 31: Payment of Dividends

31.1 Dividends shall be paid to shareholders registered on the record date determined by the Board.

31.2 Dividends may be paid by:
   (a) Cheque or warrant sent by post to the registered address
   (b) Electronic transfer to designated bank account
   (c) Any other method approved by the Board

31.3 Payment of dividend to one of joint holders shall be a valid discharge to the Company.

31.4 Any dividend unclaimed after 6 years from the date of declaration shall be forfeited and revert to the Company.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════
PART 8: TRANSFER OF SHARES
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Article 35: Transfer of Shares

35.1 Shares may be transferred by instrument in writing in the usual common form or in any other form approved by the Board.

35.2 The instrument must be signed by both the transferor and transferee.

35.3 The Board may refuse to register a transfer of shares:
   (a) If the instrument is not properly stamped (if applicable)
   (b) If the shares are not fully paid
   (c) To a person not approved by the Board (subject to Listing Rules if applicable)
   (d) If registration would result in breach of any law

35.4 If the Board refuses to register a transfer, it must send notice to the transferee within 2 months stating the reasons.

documents.title: Shareholder Information Guide 2024
documents.content:
SHAREHOLDER INFORMATION GUIDE

Tech Innovations Limited
Year 2024

Welcome Shareholders!

This guide provides important information about your rights and responsibilities as a shareholder of Tech Innovations Limited.

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
YOUR RIGHTS AS A SHAREHOLDER
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

1. VOTING RIGHTS

As an ordinary shareholder, you have the right to vote on important company matters at general meetings.

How to Vote:
• In Person: Attend the meeting and vote
• By Proxy: Appoint someone to vote on your behalf
• Online: Use our electronic proxy system (available 2024)

Voting Power:
• Each ordinary share = one vote
• You can vote on all resolutions unless you have unpaid amounts owing to the company
• On a show of hands, each shareholder present has one vote regardless of number of shares held

Proxy Voting:
• Your proxy can be any person (doesn't need to be a shareholder)
• Submit proxy form at least 24 hours before the meeting
• Proxy forms available on company website or from our share registrar
• You can specify how your proxy should vote, or give discretion

2. ATTENDING MEETINGS

Annual General Meeting (AGM):
• Held once per year, typically in May or June
• You'll receive at least 14 days' notice
• Opportunity to hear from management and ask questions
• Vote on important matters like director elections and auditor appointment

Extraordinary General Meetings (EGM):
• Called when needed for special matters
• You'll receive at least 14 days' notice
• May be called by the Board or by shareholders holding 5% or more of shares

What to Bring:
• Admission card (included with meeting notice)
• Proof of identity (HKID or passport)
• Proxy form if you appointed a proxy

3. DIVIDEND RIGHTS

You are entitled to receive dividends when declared by the company.

Dividend Policy:
• Dividends are paid based on number of shares held
• Only fully paid shares are entitled to dividends
• Board recommends dividend amount, shareholders approve at AGM
• Interim dividends may be paid during the year

Receiving Dividends:
• Dividends paid by cheque (mailed to your address) or bank transfer
• Ensure your address and bank details are up to date
• Record date determines eligibility (typically announced in advance)
• Dividends typically paid within 30 days of approval

Note: Unclaimed dividends will be forfeited after 5 years.

4. INFORMATION RIGHTS

You have the right to receive:
• Annual Report and Financial Statements
• Notices of general meetings
• Circulars on major corporate actions
• Announcements of material information

Accessing Information:
• Documents mailed to your registered address
• Available on company website (www.techinnovations.com/investors)
• Electronic delivery option available (opt-in via share registrar)
• Printed copies available upon request

5. SHARE TRANSFER RIGHTS

You may transfer your shares to another person.

Transfer Process:
1. Complete share transfer form (available from share registrar)
2. Sign the form (both buyer and seller)
3. Submit to share registrar with share certificate
4. Pay stamp duty if applicable
5. New share certificate issued to buyer

Transfer Restrictions:
• Shares must be fully paid
• Board may refuse transfer in certain circumstances
• Transfer must comply with securities laws

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

• Keep your contact details up to date
• Notify share registrar of address changes
• Respond to company communications promptly
• Vote on important matters
• Keep share certificates secure

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
REQUISITIONING A MEETING
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

Shareholders holding 5% or more of voting rights may requisition an EGM.

Process:
1. Submit written requisition to company secretary
2. State purposes of the meeting and resolutions
3. Signed by requisitionists
4. Company must convene meeting within 30 days
5. Meeting held within 45 days of requisition

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
CONTACT INFORMATION
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

documents.title: Notice of Annual General Meeting 2024
documents.content:
TECH INNOVATIONS LIMITED
Company Registration No.: 2345678

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
NOTICE OF ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that the Annual General Meeting ("AGM") of Tech Innovations Limited (the "Company") will be held at:

Date: Monday, 27 May 2024
Time: 10:00 a.m.
Venue: Conference Room, 20/F
       Tech Innovations Centre
       123 Innovation Boulevard
       Kowloon, Hong Kong

Purpose: To consider and, if thought fit, pass the following resolutions:

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
ORDINARY BUSINESS
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORDINARY RESOLUTION 1: Adoption of Audited Financial Statements

TO RECEIVE and ADOPT the audited financial statements of the Company and the reports of the directors and auditor for the year ended 31 December 2023.

ORDINARY RESOLUTION 2: Declaration of Final Dividend

TO DECLARE a final dividend of HK$0.25 per ordinary share for the year ended 31 December 2023, payable on 28 June 2024 to shareholders whose names appear on the register of members on 10 June 2024.

ORDINARY RESOLUTION 3: Re-election of Directors

TO RE-ELECT the following directors who retire by rotation in accordance with the Articles of Association:

3(a) Mr. David Chen
3(b) Ms. Sarah Wong
3(c) Dr. Michael Lee

ORDINARY RESOLUTION 4: Directors' Remuneration

TO AUTHORIZE the Board of Directors to fix the remuneration of the directors for the year ending 31 December 2024.

ORDINARY RESOLUTION 5: Re-appointment of Auditor

TO RE-APPOINT PricewaterhouseCoopers as auditor of the Company to hold office until the conclusion of the next AGM and to authorize the Board of Directors to fix their remuneration.

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SPECIAL BUSINESS
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORDINARY RESOLUTION 6: General Mandate to Issue Shares

TO GRANT a general mandate to the directors to allot, issue and deal with additional shares not exceeding 20% of the aggregate number of issued shares of the Company as at the date of passing this resolution.

SPECIAL RESOLUTION 7: Amendment to Articles of Association

TO APPROVE amendments to the Company's Articles of Association to allow for hybrid and virtual general meetings, in accordance with the draft amendments tabled at the meeting.

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
NOTES:
════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

1. ENTITLEMENT TO ATTEND AND VOTE

   Any shareholder entitled to attend and vote at the meeting may appoint one or more proxies to attend and vote instead of him/her. A proxy need not be a shareholder of the Company.

2. PROXY FORMS

   A form of proxy for use at the meeting is enclosed. To be valid, the completed form must be deposited at the Company's share registrar, Computershare Hong Kong Investor Services Limited, at 17/F Hopewell Centre, 183 Queen's Road East, Hong Kong, not less than 48 hours before the time appointed for holding the meeting or any adjournment thereof.

   Completion and return of the form of proxy will not preclude you from attending and voting in person at the meeting or any adjournment thereof should you so wish.

3. QUORUM

   The quorum for the meeting shall be three (3) shareholders present in person or by proxy representing at least 20% of the total issued share capital of the Company.

4. VOTING

   Voting on all resolutions will be conducted by poll. The results will be published on the Company's website and announced via the Stock Exchange on the day of the meeting.

5. CLOSURE OF REGISTER OF MEMBERS

   For determining entitlement to attend and vote:
   The register of members will be closed from Thursday, 23 May 2024 to Monday, 27 May 2024 (both days inclusive). To be eligible to attend and vote, all share transfer documents must be lodged with the share registrar by 4:30 p.m. on Wednesday, 22 May 2024.

   For determining entitlement to final dividend:
   The register of members will be closed from Friday, 7 June 2024 to Monday, 10 June 2024 (both days inclusive). To qualify for the final dividend, all share transfer documents must be lodged with the share registrar by 4:30 p.m. on Thursday, 6 June 2024.

6. RECORD DATE FOR DIVIDEND

   The final dividend will be paid on 28 June 2024 to shareholders registered on 10 June 2024 (record date).

7. INSPECTION OF DOCUMENTS

   Copies of the following documents will be available for inspection at the Company's registered office during normal business hours on any weekday (public holidays excepted) from the date of this notice until the date of the meeting, and at the meeting venue on the date of the meeting:

   • Service contracts of directors proposed for re-election
   • Proposed amendments to Articles of Association

8. SPECIAL RESOLUTION

   Resolution 7 will be proposed as a special resolution which requires at least 75% of votes cast to be in favor.

9. ADMISSION TO MEETING

   Shareholders or their proxies must present the admission card attached to the proxy form to gain entrance to the meeting venue. Please arrive early to facilitate registration.

10. QUESTIONS

    Shareholders may submit questions in advance by email to cosec@techinnovations.com by 20 May 2024. Questions will be addressed at the meeting or by written response.

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

By Order of the Board

Linda Tam
Company Secretary

30 April 2024

Registered Office:
20/F, Tech Innovations Centre
123 Innovation Boulevard
Kowloon, Hong Kong

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

IMPORTANT: This notice is sent to all shareholders. If you have sold or transferred your shares, please forward this document to the purchaser or transferee or to the bank, stockbroker or other agent through whom the sale or transfer was effected.

task.focus: Identify all inconsistencies across the three documents regarding: (1) proxy submission deadlines (48 hours vs 24 hours), (2) notice periods for AGM (21 days vs 14 days), (3) quorum requirements (2 shareholders with 25% vs 3 shareholders with 20%), (4) dividend forfeiture period (6 years vs 5 years), (5) EGM requisition process timelines (21 days to convene, 28 days to hold vs 30 days to convene, 45 days to hold).
